intro: Anaphalis pterocaulon var. surculosa, commonly known as the silverleaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its grayish-white leaves covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its foliage and floral structure make it a distinctive species within its genus.
